column4: my laptop is running super hot in 12.04... any suggestions? It runs really cool in windows :-\
does it also run hot if you are not logged in?
do the fans sound noisier or quieter in ubuntu than windows (also check with your hand how much pressure/volume is coming out)
I'll take notice tomorrow... the fan on this thing is really quiet so I rarely notice it.
have you noticed if unity is really slow? it could be that your graphics card has the wrong driver and the cpu is trying to do the grahic's card's job
that makes me think you don't have the right video card drivers installed
is there a little icon just to the left of the envelope icon at the top of the screen?
nope
can you run "additional drivers" from the applications menu?
ok, then it's most likely not a video card problem
is it relatively cool right now?
did you ever take temperature reading in windows (for comparison)?
ok, then we'll test by feal
please install "stress" (sudo apt-get install stress)
ok, then run "stress -c 4" and tell me if it starts getting hot :)
hit Ctrl+c to kill the program if it does get hot
yes, it will run until you kill it
sorry, should have mentioned that :P
did it get hot?
ok, then it's not your processor causing problems (that stress program just ran all 4 cpu cores to 100%)
did you say that running compiz triggered it?
brb
